page.title: 02The Older Generation
page.content: The majority of people interviewed in Rottingdean were retired and expressed a reactionary attitude towards change. They felt that there was a community atmosphere and did not wish to develop their village, only to preserve the existing environment. This country was characterised by the caring attitude freedom of speech, mums out shopping, and changeable weather. They valued England for its patriotic atmosphere, democratic voting and legal system, Sunday closing and its Royal Family. They feared that many of these aspects of Britain might be left behind with increasing unemployment, violence and crime. Children should be learning values of self discipline and respect.
